intro: Monochaetum glanduliferum, commonly known as the glandular spike rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Australia, particularly found in the eastern regions, including New South Wales and Queensland. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, upright leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Monochaetum glanduliferum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
